participants: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire

messages.sender: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire
messages.message: Hi team :wave:  I'm looking for 1-2 folks who can attend Office Hours with Bank of America tomorrow with me from 11:30-12pm pst. They mostly have questions with OCR, UDFs, and Table Refiner - I can answer a few questions but could use help. Please let me know if you are free and can help out!

I don’t have as much recent context anymore on UDFs and OCR, but I’d love to attend in a supporting role if we have another eng. I wasn’t even aware that Table Refiner was actually being evaluated by them — what are they using it for?
any change i can shadow this call?
for my learning

messages.sender: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire
messages.message: I can add you both - anyone who wants to speak to OCR/UDF who can join?
@Jonathan Shih any chance you could help join here? You’ll have context on these topics I believe
yep I can join. although not sure how much help i will be regarding table refiner
I think only @Kerry knows how to wield the full power of Table Refiner :)
xD fair enough

messages.sender: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire
messages.message: it's so early for Kerry so hopefully we can cover it without and follow up with information afterwards.
yeah wouldn’t involve her either haha. i think i can handle most of it, so should be fine

messages.sender: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire
messages.message: In the meantime they had this question specifically:

messages.sender: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire
messages.message: > How to display Table Refiner output in a Sheet application?
This should just be a matter of right clicking on the output ibocr and opening with sheet, right?

messages.sender: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire
messages.message: I think so?

Do we officially support table refiner? My 2c would be to not encourage people using apps that we don’t have documentation for. It’s def super useful, so in the case we want to invest in and use it, we should create some legit docs
Else we’re stuck in the same loop of many apps that half-do what the users want

messages.sender: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire
messages.message: It's included in BAML's contract as a production app - are there plans to continue work on Table Refiner?
I do not see any plans for work on it in our planning roadmap https://instabase.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/PROD/pages/83034166/3.+Roadmap+Creation, but @Kerry prolly has the definitive say

:disappointed: Table Refiner is going away…. I didn’t know that it’s included in the contract, there’s no plan to continue developing it. The plan is to merge its functionalities into Refiner V5. But right now R5 still needs to get its basic set of features working, so merging TR to R5 will probably be a task in the second half of the year. @georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire How can I work with you to set the correct expectation for BAML. I won’t be able to attend the office hour tomorrow, sorry. I think best approach going forward is to get them to use Refiner / Refiner 5 and never touch Table Refiner ever again.

TR’s output is a ibocr, so they can just open that ibocr with sheet. TR currently is not p3 compatible, although I can make a change quickly to support that. Which release is BAML on and what’s the plan to ship a new release to them?

Overall we really need to do a house cleaning of the beta apps. I should take TR down in the next release.

messages.sender: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire
messages.message: We are going to set up a time to discuss all the apps promised to BAML and how we manage expectations with what our plans are for support various apps.

messages.sender: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire
messages.message: I'll set this up with Justin & Jesika!
